Plot Distribution Of Clonotype Frequencies

Source: R/plot_frequency.R
PlotClonotypeDist.Rd

PlotClonotypeDist plots the distribution of clonotype frequencies. Frequency bins are predefined to focus on rare populations.

PlotClonotypeDist(
  data,
  palette = "bold10",
  title = TRUE,
  x.text.angle = 45,
  barOutline = TRUE,
  legend = TRUE,
  gridlines = TRUE,
  alpha = 0.5,
  label = TRUE,
  theme = "pubr",
  bg.color = "light"
)

Arguments

data

Can be a dataframe with clonotype IDs as "clonotype_id" or frequencies as "Freq". Can also be a Seurat object containing with either of the same column names and data
palette

Palettes available in ggplot2, ggsci, or with PullPalettes. Default = "bold10"
title

Logical. Whether to include plot title or not
x.text.angle

Numerical. Angle of the text labels on the x-axis. Default = 45
barOutline

Logical. Whether to include a black outline around the bars in the plot
legend

Logical. Whether to include the legend or not
gridlines

Logical. Include y-axis
alpha

Numerical between 0-1. Alpha level applied to bar-fill.
label

Logical. Add numerical label to the top of the bars
theme

Either ggpubr::theme_pubr("pubr"), or ggpubr::pubclean ("clean"), or ggpubr::theme_transparent ("transparent")
bg.color

Helpful param for applying a global light or dark theme in a scheme, such as global theme for Shiny apps. "light" or "dark".

Value

PlotClonotypeDist returns a single ggplot barplot object.

See also

MakeFrequencyDF PlotTopClonotypes

Examples

plot <- PlotClonotypeDist(data = pbmc_vdj)
